sen.j: 丹波（たんば）
sen.e: Tamba
Tamba
Tanba

sen.j: 丹波国（たんばのくに）
sen.e: Tamba Province
Tamba Province
Tanba Province

sen.j: 丹波郡（たにはぐん／たんばぐん） - 中郡 (京都府)の古称。
sen.e: Taniha-gun or Tamba-gun District -- the old name of Nakagun (Kyoto Prefecture)
Taniha-gun or Tamba-gun District -- the old name of Nakagun (Kyoto Prefecture)
Taniha-gun or Tanba-gun District: the old name of Naka-gun (Kyoto Prefecture)

sen.j: 京都府における丹波地方。
sen.e: Tamba region in Kyoto Prefecture.
Tamba region in Kyoto Prefecture.
Tanba region in Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 京都丹波とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: It is also called Kyoto Tamba.
It is also called Kyoto Tamba.
It is also called Kyoto Tanba.

sen.j: 中丹のうち舞鶴市を除いた区域と南丹からなる。
sen.e: It is comprised of Chutan (excluding Maizuru City) and Nantan.
It is comprised of Chutan (excluding Maizuru City) and Nantan.
It is comprised of Chutan (excluding Maizuru City) and Nantan.

sen.j: 兵庫県丹波県民局の管轄区域。
sen.e: The jurisdiction of the Tamba Branch Office in Kyoto Prefecture,
sen.cmt: 単語用語リストのリンク先では、branch officeが使われてます。http://72.14.235.132/search?q=cache:Hsf5QSqSgfYJ:www.pref.mie.jp/ENGLISH/overview/e_p08_09.pdf+%E7%9C%8C%E6%B0%91%E5%B1%80+citizen&cd=1&hl=ja&ct=clnk&gl=jp
sen.e: The jurisdiction of the Tamba Branch Office in Kyoto Prefecture
The jurisdiction of the Tanba Branch Office in Kyoto Prefecture

sen.j: 兵庫丹波とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: It is also called Hyogo Tamba,
It is also called Hyogo Tamba,
It is also called Hyogo Tanba.

sen.j: 篠山市と丹波市からなる。
sen.e: It is comprised of Sasayama City and Tamba City
It is comprised of Sasayama City and Tamba City
It is comprised of Sasayama City and Tanba City

sen.j: 丹波市 - 兵庫県丹波市（たんばし）
sen.e: Tamba City -- Tamba City Hyogo Prefecture
Tamba City -- Tamba City Hyogo Prefecture
Tanba City -- Tanba City, Hyogo Prefecture

sen.j: 丹波町 - 京都府船井郡丹波町（たんばちょう）（現在は京丹波町）
sen.e: Tamba-cho -- Tamba-cho Funaigun Kyoto Prefecture (present-day Hyogo Tamba)
Tamba-cho -- Tamba-cho Funaigun Kyoto Prefecture (present-day Hyogo Tamba)
Tanba-cho -- Tanba-cho, Funai-gun, Kyoto Prefecture (the present-day Kyotanba-cho)

sen.j: 丹波村 - 京都府中郡 (京都府)丹波村（現在は京丹後市）
sen.e: Tamba-mura -- Tamba-mura (Kyoto Prefecture) Nakagun Kyoto Prefecture (present-day Kyotango City)
sen.cmt: (Kyoto Prefecture)はいらないと思います。
sen.e: Tamba-mura -- Tamba-mura (Kyoto Prefecture) Nakagun Kyoto Prefecture (present-day Kyotango City)
Tanba-mura -- Tanba-mura (Kyoto Prefecture), Naka-gun, Kyoto Prefecture (the present-day Kyotango City)
sen.cmt: naka-gunとしました。 コンマ追加

sen.j: 列車名。
sen.e: Railroad names
Names of railroads
Names of railroads

sen.j: 共に丹波国に由来するが、期間により漢字表記・仮名表記があり、また運行区間も異なる。
sen.e: The following two names both originated from Tamba Province, but their notations (kanji or kana) and operational lines differ, depending on the periods.
The following two names originated from Tamba Province, but their notations (kanji or kana) and operational lines differ according to their respective periods.

The following two names originated from Tanba Province, but their notations (kanji (chinese characters) or kana (Japanese syllabary characters)) and operational lines differ according to their respective periods.
sen.cmt: (kanji (chinese characters) or kana (Japanese syllabary characters))として説明を補足しました。

sen.j: 「丹波」 - 1986年まで日本国有鉄道が福知山線経由大阪駅・新大阪駅～兵庫県北西部・京都府北部を運行していた急行列車の名称。
sen.e: Tamba -- an express train operated until 1986 by the Japanese National Railways from Osaka Station and Shin-Osaka Station to the northeast of Hyogo Prefecture and the north of Kyoto Prefecture via Fukuchiyama Line

Tamba -- an express train operated until 1986 by the Japanese National Railways from Osaka Station and Shin-Osaka Station to the northeast of Hyogo Prefecture and the north of Kyoto Prefecture via the Fukuchiyama Line

Tanba' (丹波) -- an express train operated until 1986 by the Japan National Railways from Osaka Station and Shin-Osaka Station to the northeast of Hyogo Prefecture and the north of Kyoto Prefecture via the Fukuchiyama Line
sen.cmt: '追加 国鉄をJapan National Railwaysとしました（前出ファイルと統一） 上記の文で、「漢字、仮名表記と両方ある」とありますので、ここは漢字の「丹波」を追加しました。

sen.j: 北近畿_(列車)を参照のこと。
sen.e: See Limited Express Kitakinki.
See "Limited Express Kitakinki" for details.
See "Limited Express Kitakinki" for details.

sen.j: 「たんば」 - 1996年より西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）が京都駅～福知山駅間を山陰本線綾部駅経由で運行している特別急行列車。
sen.e: Limited Express Tamba -- a special express train operated from 1996 by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) from Kyoto Station to Fukuchiyama Station via Ayabe Station on the San'in Main Line
Limited Express Tamba -- a special express train operated from 1996 by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) from Kyoto Station to Fukuchiyama Station via Ayabe Station on the San'in Main Line
Limited Express Tanba' (たんば)-- a special express train operated from 1996 by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) from Kyoto Station to Fukuchiyama Station via Ayabe Station on the Sanin Main Line
sen.cmt: ここも、上記の文を受けて、平仮名表記の「たんば」を追加しました。

sen.j: たんば_(列車)を参照のこと。
sen.e: See Limited Express Tamba.
See Limited Express Tamba.
See "Limited Express Tanba" for details.

sen.j: 日本人の姓の1つ - 丹波氏、丹波哲郎など。
sen.e: One of Japanese family names -- Tamba clan, Tetsuro TAMBA, and so forth
One of the Japanese family names -- Tamba clan, Tetsuro TAMBA, and so forth
One of the Japanese family names -- Tanba clan, Tetsuro TANBA, and so forth

sen.j: 丹波立杭焼（たんばたちくいやき）
sen.e: Tamba Tachikui Pottery
Tamba Tachikui Pottery
Tanba Tachikui Pottery
